query.result: | Italian | Derived | Etymology | |---|---|---| | Atamante | Greek | From the Greek name Ἀθάμας (Athamas), possibly meaning "unyielding" or "unconquered". | | divenire | Latin | From the Latin verb *devenire*, meaning "to become" or "to come to be". | | tanto | Latin | From the Latin adverb *tanto*, meaning "so much" or "to such an extent". | | insano | Latin | From the Latin adjective *insanus*, meaning "insane" or "mad". | | che | Latin | From the Latin conjunction *que*, meaning "and" or "that". | | vedere | Latin | From the Latin verb *videre*, meaning "to see" or "to perceive". | | il | Latin | From the Latin definite article *ille*, meaning "the". | | moglie | Latin | From the Latin word *mulier*, meaning "woman" or "wife". | | con | Latin | From the Latin preposition *cum*, meaning "with" or "together with". | | due | Latin | From the Latin numeral *duo*, meaning "two". | | figlio | Latin | From the Latin word *filius*, meaning "son". | | andare | Germanic | From the Germanic verb *andjan*, meaning "to go" or "to move". | | caricare | Germanic | From the Germanic verb *karjan*, meaning "to load" or "to burden". | | da | Latin | From the Latin preposition *de*, meaning "from" or "out of". | | ciascuno | Latin | From the Latin phrase *quisque unus*, meaning "each one". | | mano | Latin | From the Latin word *manus*, meaning "hand". |
